Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of the Board's assessment of the objective basis of the applicant's claim
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant found credible as a Catholic, but claims of persecution not supported
Legal_Provision: Section 97(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution based on Roman Catholic faith
Evaluation_Standard: Objective basis for fear of persecution
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of evidence of personal risk despite general conditions
Application_Factor: Credibility, documentary evidence of religious practice in Fujian
Decision_Outcome: Applicant not recognized as a Convention refugee
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of objective evidence of persecution risk
Evidentiary_Issues: Absence of arrest warrant or direct evidence of targeting
Credibility_Issues: Credible applicant but insufficient link between faith and state persecution
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of Board's decision
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (indirectly)
